body_html:
@formath could you provide environment infomation? Say, tensorflow version etc.

import tensorflow as tf
a = tf.constant([[[1, 1, 1], [2, 2, 2]],
                         [[3, 3, 3], [4, 4, 4]],
                         [[5, 5, 5], [6, 6, 6]]], dtype=tf.int64)

b = tf.strided_slice(a, [1, 0, 0], [2, 1, 3], [1, 1, 1])

with tf.Session() as sess:
    print(sess.run(b))        # [[[3 3 3]]]

I test the script above on tf 1.3, and it works well.

body:
@formath could you provide environment infomation? Say, tensorflow version etc.

```python
import tensorflow as tf
a = tf.constant([[[1, 1, 1], [2, 2, 2]],
                         [[3, 3, 3], [4, 4, 4]],
                         [[5, 5, 5], [6, 6, 6]]], dtype=tf.int64)

b = tf.strided_slice(a, [1, 0, 0], [2, 1, 3], [1, 1, 1])

with tf.Session() as sess:
    print(sess.run(b))        # [[[3 3 3]]]
```

I test the script above on tf 1.3, and it works well.
